alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:02AM EST until February 20 at 7:27PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. .Heavy rain from earlier this week will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 37.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 39.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 39.1 feet on 03/12/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by midday Sunday.
